content.raw: I'd like to be able to un-comment this line and and an EXPECT_EQ line, but because blurring (sub-1 pixel) from the use of a distortion map, a completely undistorted camera (no <distortion> in the SDF) doesn't give the same result as a camera with distortion, but with all the distortion parameters set to 0.
content.html: I'd like to be able to un-comment this line and and an EXPECT_EQ line, but because blurring (sub-1 pixel) from the use of a distortion map, a completely undistorted camera (no <distortion> in the SDF) doesn't give the same result as a camera with distortion, but with all the distortion parameters set to 0.

content.raw: Is there a reason why the parameters for the camera with barrel distortion are being changed?
content.html: Is there a reason why the parameters for the camera with barrel distortion are being changed?

content.raw:
The original parameters seemed arbitrary, but the second parameter was positive. For the most barrel-y barrel distortion, all the parameters should be negative.

The tangential distortion values are also unnecessary, and might throw off the test because of opposing effects with the radial parameters. I didn't look at tangential distortion too much in this PR, additional work would be needed to write a test for it. The tangential values are extremely small for most cameras.
content.html:
The original parameters seemed arbitrary, but the second parameter was positive. For the most barrel-y barrel distortion, all the parameters should be negative.

The tangential distortion values are also unnecessary, and might throw off the test because of opposing effects with the radial parameters. I didn't look at tangential distortion too much in this PR, additional work would be needed to write a test for it. The tangential values are extremely small for most cameras.

content.raw: Thanks for the explanation. I was mainly wondering if this pull request would change the results for previously defined barrel distortions. I'm asking because this is targeted at Gazebo 7, and it could be frustrating for users if they update Gazebo and suddenly their cameras start giving slightly different results.
content.html: Thanks for the explanation. I was mainly wondering if this pull request would change the results for previously defined barrel distortions. I'm asking because this is targeted at Gazebo 7, and it could be frustrating for users if they update Gazebo and suddenly their cameras start giving slightly different results.

I just tried merging this forward to gazebo8, but there were a ton of conflicts due to pull request #2529:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo7%0Dgazebo8#diff

Is someone up for trying to merge this forward? I would recommend making a new branch for the merge and a pull request to make sure there are no regressions. It won't be subject to the full code review; a happy jenkins should be enough
